unit: Unit 6 | Inference for Categorical Data: Proportions
title: What Is the Largest Confidence Level? $2$-sided Test
question_text:
A one proportion $z$-test was used to conduct a test of the null hypotheses:
$$H_0: p = 0.74 $$ $$H_A: p \neq 0.74$$
The $p$-value was $0.062$. A confidence interval for $p$ is to be constructed.
Of the following, which is the largest level of confidence for which the confidence interval will NOT contain $0.74$?
solution:
We do not want the confidence interval to contain $0.74$, which indicates we want to reject the null hypotheses.

For each one of the confidence levels, create the significance level that corresponds to the confidence level.

Next, see if you would reject or fail to reject the null hypotheses using the $p$-value and significance level.

For a $90\%$ confidence level, the significance level is $10\%$. $0.062 < 0.10$; therefore we reject the null hypothesis.

For a $92\%$ confidence level, the significance level is $8\%$. $0.062 < 0.08$; therefore we reject the null hypothesis.

For a $94\%$ confidence level, the significance level is $6\%$. $0.062 > 0.06$; therefore we fail to reject the null hypothesis.

For a $95\%$ confidence level, the significance level is $5\%$. $0.062 > 0.05$; therefore we fail to reject the null hypothesis.

For a $99\%$ confidence level, the significance level is $1\%$. $0.062 > 0.01$; therefore we fail to reject the null hypothesis.

The largest confidence level that will not contain $0.062$ is $92\%$.
